page.title: 14RECREATION - WEST LEOMINSTER
page.content: There are no public facilities for recreation within the area and any recreation is participative rather than of the spectator variety. A number of fishing clubs fish the rivers and day licences are available in many places. The Radnor and West Herefordshire and North Herefordshire Hunts hunt the countryside. There is private shooting which covers most of the area and a fair amount of poaching is known to take place. Riding classes are held locally and many people own their own ponies and horses. There is an annual Point-to-Point held at Cursneh Hill on May Day Bank Holiday, which attracts people from outside the area. A number of local teams enter the annual raft race on the River Wye from Hay-on-Wye to Chepstow, for charity.
